| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               | [SLASH'EM\_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1538](/wiki/SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1538 "SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c") |

A **nickelpede**, s, is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is a stronger relative of the [centipede](/wiki/Centipede "Centipede"),

A nickelpede has a [poisonous](/wiki/Poison "Poison") bite attack, and possesses [poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance").

Eating a nickelpede [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") or [tin](/wiki/Tin "Tin") has a 8⁄15 chance of conveying poison resistance.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 Origin](#Origin)
- [4 References](#References)

## Generation

Randomly generated nickelpedes are always created hostile, and are not generated in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom").

Nickelpedes appear among the random s that are part of the first [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") monster class for [Tourists](/wiki/Tourist "Tourist") and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Tourist quest](/wiki/Tourist_quest "Tourist quest"). They also appear among the random s that are part of the second quest monster class for [Rangers](/wiki/Ranger "Ranger") and make up 6⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the [Ranger quest](/wiki/Ranger_quest "Ranger quest").

Nickelpedes generated at level creation are given a random item to hide under.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Strategy

While much more capable of inflicting damage compared to the standard centipede, nickelpedes are just as slow at 4 [speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed"), and are not a significant threat to a character that can keep them away with [projectiles](/wiki/Projectile "Projectile") and other [ranged attacks](/wiki/Ranged_attack "Ranged attack"). Nickelpedes are also similarly vulnerable to magic due to lacking any [MR score](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)"), and their corpses can be a decent source of poison resistance for characters that lack the property.

## Origin

The nickelpede is based on a [pun](/wiki/Pun "Pun") of the words "cent" and "centipede", and is derived from the [Xanth](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xanth "wikipedia:Xanth") novels. In *[Currant Events](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Currant_Events "wikipedia:Currant Events")*, nickelpedes are described as "five times as bad as centipedes, gouging out nickel-sized disks of flesh".

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [makemon.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 1532](/wiki/Source:SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/makemon.c#line1532 "Source:SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/makemon.c"): *spiders and the like get a free house*

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

Nickelpede

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
s nickelpede
Difficulty 10
Attacks Bite 3d4 poison
s nickelpede
Difficulty 10
Attacks

Bite 3d4 poison

Base level 8
Base experience 121
Speed 4
Base AC 3
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 150
Nutritional value 50
Size Medium
Resistances poison
Resistances conveyed poison (53%)

A nickelpede:

  • can hide under items.
  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • can lay eggs.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • does not appear in Gehennom.
Reference SLASH'EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line1538

A nickelpede, s, is a type of monster that appears in SLASH'EM, SlashTHEM and Hack'EM. It is a stronger relative of the centipede,

A nickelpede has a poisonous bite attack, and possesses poison resistance.

Eating a nickelpede corpse or tin has a 8⁄15 chance of conveying poison resistance.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 Origin
  • 4 References

Generation

Randomly generated nickelpedes are always created hostile, and are not generated in Gehennom.

Nickelpedes appear among the random s that are part of the first quest monster class for Tourists and make up 24⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Tourist quest. They also appear among the random s that are part of the second quest monster class for Rangers and make up 6⁄175 of the monsters randomly generated on the Ranger quest.

Nickelpedes generated at level creation are given a random item to hide under.[1]

Strategy

While much more capable of inflicting damage compared to the standard centipede, nickelpedes are just as slow at 4 speed, and are not a significant threat to a character that can keep them away with projectiles and other ranged attacks. Nickelpedes are also similarly vulnerable to magic due to lacking any MR score, and their corpses can be a decent source of poison resistance for characters that lack the property.

Origin

The nickelpede is based on a pun of the words "cent" and "centipede", and is derived from the Xanth novels. In Currant Events, nickelpedes are described as "five times as bad as centipedes, gouging out nickel-sized disks of flesh".

References

  1. ↑ makemon.c in SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2, line 1532: spiders and the like get a free house

A '''nickelpede''', {{monsym|nickelpede}}, is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[SLASH'EM]], [[SlashTHEM]] and [[Hack'EM]]. It is a stronger relative of the [[centipede]], 

A nickelpede has a [[poison]]ous bite attack, and possesses [[poison resistance]].

Eating a nickelpede [[corpse]] or [[tin]] has a {{frac|8|15}} chance of conveying poison resistance.

==Generation==
Randomly generated nickelpedes are always created hostile, and are not generated in [[Gehennom]].

Nickelpedes appear among the random {{white|s}} that are part of the first [[quest]] monster class for [[Tourist]]s and make up {{frac|24|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Tourist quest]]. They also appear among the random {{white|s}} that are part of the second quest monster class for [[Ranger]]s and make up {{frac|6|175}} of the monsters randomly generated on the [[Ranger quest]].

Nickelpedes generated at level creation are given a random item to hide under.{{refsrc|makemon.c|1532|version=SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2|comment=spiders and the like get a free house}}

==Strategy==
While much more capable of inflicting damage compared to the standard centipede, nickelpedes are just as slow at 4 [[speed]], and are not a significant threat to a character that can keep them away with [[projectile]]s and other [[ranged attack]]s. Nickelpedes are also similarly vulnerable to magic due to lacking any [[Magic resistance (monster)|MR score]], and their corpses can be a decent source of poison resistance for characters that lack the property.

==Origin==
The nickelpede is based on a [[pun]] of the words "cent" and "centipede", and is derived from the [[wikipedia:Xanth|Xanth]] novels. In ''[[Wikipedia:Currant Events|Currant Events]]'', nickelpedes are described as "five times as bad as centipedes, gouging out nickel-sized disks of flesh".
